title: Can you say, "Mini!"?!?
review:
When I heard about this set, I was overjoyed to know that there was finally gona be a hailfire droid set other than that technic one, and I was also glad to know that it was gona be in-expensive compared to other sets. But what I didn't know is that the hailfire droid was freakishly small! It was funny 'cause someone I know saw it and asked me, "Hay, where did you get that one set, you know that MINI hailfire droid?" I laughed! 

Anyways, I think that the prievious spider droid was better designed(the leggs mainly) but I like the brown. The minifigs are great! I also love the new rocket pieces: they stay implace and fire out easily! Plus, I love the clever use of clear pieces on this set! Yep, this set is great, except the fact that the hailfire droid can fit in the palm of your hand! :P

author: Manxboi24
title: Nice Little Set
review:
OK, I got this set a few weeks ago and I'm finally getting around to reviewing it.  If you don't already know, this set contains two battle droids, one droid commander, a super battle droid, a spider droid, and last but not least, a hailfire droid.  

Pieces:

This set contains 249 pieces, eighty of which are treads.  It does include some very nice tan and brown bits, as well as the new variation of flick fire missile, one of those space bubbles, the clear dishes, used to hold the chains, and some exoforce-looking parts on the spider droid.  In other words, loads of great pieces to make MOCs with!

The Build:

The build is fairly simple with the minifigs, then the hailfire, and then the spider droid being built.  The only tedious parts in this build are putting the chains together and building the legs to the spider droid.  Other than that, it's smooth sailing!

Minifigs:

OK, mostly, the minifigs are nothing special.  The two regular battle droids are exactly the same as those found in the newest MTT and the super battle droid is the same one that is in the droids battlepack.  However, the droid commander is a new variation of battle droids, getting its full torso in yellow as opposed to the ones in earlier models.  

Spider Droid:

I actually like the spider droid more than the one in the Wookiee Attack set.  It is the right colour and it has a much better size and shape compared to the blue one.   The only problem with it is that the legs are extremely annoying to have to align.  Although they are a lot better in mobility as compared to the old spider droid, they are extremely hard to keep in the same position and can be annoying to move.

Hailfire Droid:

This is, without a shadow of a doubt, the centrepiece of the set.  The wheels, made up of little treads on top of a clear disk, run smoothly and look pretty cool.  The missiles are cool, even though there is only eight.  It's better that they stay in place and are still flick fire.  However, it's strange that the small front gun is added.  As it is kinda easy to mod on, I find it strange how TLC didn't include it.  

Overall:

This set is one of the nicest for the first half of the year and is definitely a larger army builder type set.  It is also worth the $20 it costs.  Overall, I'd say 9/10!

The army droids are great, the spider droid is a total flop  but can be attained more accuratley in the clone wars sets but for a much higher price.

author: ShatteredGnome
title: The Droid Army Lives!
review:
I never thought of getting this set until I popped in to the LEGO store and nothing I wanted was in stock. I saw this in a crumpled box, one left, and said, "Why didn't I think of this?" The set has three battle droids, all with the new blaster arms, and a super battle droid, plus the army strengthening hailfire droid and spider droid. The hailfire droid is pretty good; color scheme is better than the technic, but runs a bit small; the spider droid is creatively built and is better than the blue/grey one in the Wookie Attack set. Overall, a great set. Get a couple of these, add an AAT or a large Spider Droid, and you have a formidable army.

Pros: -4 great droids
-missles
-spider droid's legs
Cons: -Hailfire Droid's wheels a bit delicate

Overall: 8.5/10

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - Hailfire Droid & Spider Droid Review
review:
This LEGO Star Wars set is a very nice army builder which I got. It comes with a huge tank which I think is called the hailfire droid. The treads are able to sviwel and the flick-missiles are also able to move. You get 8 flick-missiles in total which is very cool for a LEGO set. This set also comes with 2 regular battle droids, a commander droid with the yellow battle droid torso and the dark gray super battle droid.

The other vehicle which comes with this set is called the spider droid. This small droid has two legs on each side and on the front is a movable turret. The eyes can sviwel too and this vehicle also has a brown ball piece which has an antenna on the top. I really can't complain about this set and you also won't have to worry about stickers.

All in all this set is a great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de


Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: Niallskie
title: Wasn't what I was expecting
review: I gave it a bit of a thought before actually buying this set and was actually excited to build it. Opened the boxed and slid down the lego pieces in plastic and hmmmmm, not to much bricks. Knowing how lego is, sometimes you would thing that there is not much brick but you will be amazed how it turned out in the end, so I kept my good hopes going. It was an easy build, but I was not happy with the result. In fairness the Hailfire Droid looks cool, but rather too small for my taste, same goes for the spider droid. This set is definitely a must if you want to recreate the clone war battle, other than that it's a one time buy for me.

author: legoDad42
title: Good Droid Army Builder.
review:
The Hailfire and Spider Droid is a decent and fun addition to your Droid Army.

You could even say this is another 'droid battle pack', since all the characters here are droids (Hailfire, Spider, Battle-Droid Commander, 2 Battle Droids, Super Battle Droid).
Easy build but a nice addition to your Droid Army collection with a very powerful Hailfire Droid.

Pro's-Hailfire droid design with movable treads(can be tilted straight or on an angle-looks best at angle) and 8 flick fire missiles (also on a tilting axis to vary your fire position), Battle Droid Commander (yellow torso), Spider Droid has adjustable/somewhat poseable legs.


Con's-Super Battle Droid has both arms normal. Meaning, one of his arms isn't the 'gun' arm that the newer Super Battle Droids have. Hailfire and Spider Droid are quite a bit smaller than the scale of the ones from the movies.

 

This set would've been a champ if at least the Hailfire was much larger and more menacing as well as changing the fire mechanisms for the 8 missiles to a spring loaded or somthing close to the firing mechanism on the Troll Assault Wagon.

author: DarthSteve
title: Another Great Set
review:
Firstly, I am rating this set as a 5 out of 5, but I have to say that I think the LEGO Makers should have put a little more thought into this one, namely the Spider Droid. Don't get me wrong, I love the Spider Droid - there's absolutely nothing wrong with it; it's really cute actually, and I love it! I'm merely suggesting that they could have made it larger with a little more solidity given to it, like the Hailfire Droid.

In my personal opinion, the two droids should have been equal in size and that's all there is to it. My main issue here is the Spider Droid's legs. If it was even slightly larger, maybe some mechanics could have been incorporated into it and some sturdier pairs of legs could have been attached (similar to the legs on the Separatist Shuttle or the Clone Walker, for example).

On to the Pros of this set; and trust me, there are plenty of reasons to love this set! One of those reasons is the price, sold at about $30.00 Canadian.

The slew of minifigs included in this set is fantastic. Not only do you get two more regular Battle Droids for your Trade Federation Army, but you also get a Battle Droid Commander (distinguishable by its yellow body) and a Super Battle Droid, which are usually only included in the larger, more expensive sets, like the Armored Assault Tank. However, please note here that the Super Battle Droid included in this set has two regular arms - no Blaster Arm like the ones in the AAT set have.

Moving on to the parts of the set itself, I consider this a great value because you sort of get a two-part set. We have the Spider Droid that I already mentioned, plus the Hailfire Droid, which is very impressive, in my opinion anyway. The two glass wheels are surrounded by brown interlocking tread pieces, creating a very cool and unique design for the wheels on the droid. It also comes with eight flick missiles for heavy fire. The Hailfire Droid can fold up and fold out for both combat and non-combat stances.

In summary: If you love LEGO STAR WARS, buy this set!

Pros:
Minifigs: Battle Droid (x2), Battle Droid Commander, Super Battle Droid
Two-part Set: Hailfire Droid, Spider Droid
Price

Cons:
Overall Size of Spider Droid/Spider Droid's Legs

Parts: The parts are good, Brown is Good Color. And Shape of Parts is good too. And very much Extra parts.

Playability: Is good, is you have Clones Already. Play in it is Trikcy without they. Else Playability is Good, Al parts move good.

Value for money: This is a Little expensive set, but price what i bought it is an very inexpensive. 

Briefly:

Pros:
-Color of Parts.
-Shape of parts.
-Spider droid is Cute.
-Halfire droid is Cool.
-Cool Minifigs.
-Much Extra Parts.
-Mobility.
-Price What I Bought it.

Cons
-Prise In Finland.
-Playability without Clones.
-Building.

This is good set. Price And Building is only cons. Buy this set if you like new trilogy.

PS: Aim Sorry if this is not So clear. In Finland we didin´t speak Egland every day.

author: StarWarsLegoFan123
title: Small, But Good
review:
This set is a good starter set for a Droid Army. Unfortunately, Lego has completely messed up the scale. But, to the Pros and Cons.

Pros:

1. Has 4 droids, plus a spider droid
2. A commander droid :)
3. Good amount of pieces
4. Rolls nicely on carpet
5. Pretty low price

Cons: 

1. Completely off scale (watch Episode II to find out)
2. Doesn't roll on wooden floor :(
3. Front Flaps (triangle pieces) fall off easily
4. Flick fire missiles :s

I took it apart to make my own battle droid carrier/transporter. But get it if you want a droid army, or at least a start of one.

title: Great but doesn't roll well
review:
This is a really good set the only flaw is the Hailfire droid doesn't really roll.
Minifigures: Battle Droid Commander: 10/10 ONly in one other set and and is a really good minifig. It's good if you want a leader for all your droids.
Battle Droid: 7/10: An Average Battle droid
Super Battle Droid: 10/10 An awesome awesome super battle droid. It is a great addition to any star wars collection/

Dwarf Spider Droid: 10/10 This is another cool thing. There really isn't much too it but is greaat when placed on an battlefield. 

Hailfire Droid 9/10 The only problems are this. The wheels don't roll well and one of the flick fire missiles always fall out. But the flick fire missiles other wise are great and is a neat design/ It isn't hard to build but directions can be a bit misleading at times. I would recomend this to anyone.

author: CaptainJonnyBoy
title: "We've got droids!"
review:
This set is sweet! Me and my brother bought two, but then he sold me his and my clones got dangerously outnumbered. I think this is a great set for starting or reinforcing your droid army, and is considered as a large battle-pack by me and my friends, who call it "the Hailfire-pack".

Pros and Cons

Pros:
  • Comes with Commander battle droid (yellow torso), Super battle droid, and two normal battle droid minifigures

  • Hailfire droid "rolls" actually the treads just slide on the transparent discs.

  • Has eight flick-firing missiles that work great
  • Hailfire droid has a tab on the back so you can "drive" it
  • Dwarf spider droid has moving legs and gun
  • Tilting wheels and missile launchers
  • Great army booster
  • Good colors and pieces
  • No annoying stickers (Decals, whatever)
  • Two extra tread pieces
Cons:

  • Hailfire droid is a bit too small
  • Spider droid is a bit too big, but great anyway
  • Commander battle droid is not printed, Lego lazily gave it a yellow torso instead
And that's it!

I recommend this set to anyone looking for a cheap way to build their droid army.

I hope you found my review helpful and will buy this set! (if you can still find one, that is)

author: unleashed
title: "What a piece of junk!" should be "That's no moon, that's a space station!"
review:
Everything else is all good except the size of that hailfire droid-it should be bigger.

  • Pros:
  • Commander
  • Super Battle Droid
  • Battle Droids
  • Cons:
  • No Geonosians
  • No Clones
  • No Jedi
  • Small Hailfire droid
  • Small amount of Missiles
  • No Blaster for hailfire droid
  • Not enough droids

author: Odeinoichus
title: Droids!
review:
Set #7670 Hailfire Droid & Spider Droid: Although it is said to be a Clone Wars set I always pictured this as an addition to any Episode II Geonosis Scene.

 

That being said, let us review the set. I'm not sure what others have said already about this set so let's start with a few interesting observations. This set features a new straight armed Battle Droid design, which allows the Battle Droids to hold the blaster pieces given to them the correct orientation.

 

The Dwarf Spider Droid in this set is built fairly simply, but it is a bit on the loose side as far as the lower legs are concerned. The connection piece slides in snuggly, but it doesn't click, so the lower legs are always flopping around and around in circles when you try to pose it properly. Not to say though that they are going to move around all of the time, it seems to depend on some factor that I haven't quite nailed down yet.

 

The Hailfire Droid is a clever design. Although much smaller than the original Technic design (which I don't yet own) it still looks impressive in any display. And the build involves some nice steps and equally interesting pieces. (This was my first experience with the little interconnecting LEGO chain-links.) There are also flick-fire missiles, eight of them, and they work quite well.

 

True you only get four mini-figures with this set, but in a way the Hailfire and Dwarf Spider Droids are like Maxi-Figures for your LEGO display since they represent varied tools of the Droid Army. Overall I really liked this set, the new Super Battle Droid coloring looks metallic and passably shiney and more Droids for your army can never be bad. I liked it so much I bought two of them and would probably have picked up more later on down the road if I could afford it.

author: DarthDarthBinks2
title: Build an Army of Droids
review:
I got this set for Christmas alongside the Hyena Droid Bomber, and this set does not fail to impress! We get 4 droids, a Hailfire Droid, and a Spider Droid.

Pros

  • Great for building up an army.
  • Interesting building techniques.
  • 8 flick missiles on Hailfire for devastating attacks.
  • Great Price

Cons

  • Hailfire Droid wheels work only on carpet
  • Frustrating to pose Spider Droid
  • Super Battle Droid's arms tend to snap easily, so ordering more can be a bother.
  • No clone troopers to fight the droids.

All in all, this set is worth the money, and I highly recommend this set.

author: legostarwarsiscoolcr
title: Hailfire and spider droid set 7670
review:
Pros

  • 4 Mini-figs
  • 2 Vehicles
  • Good for building up and army

Cons

  • No Jedi
  • No Clones
  • No Geonosians
  • Spider Droid hard to pose

Overall Great Set, but could do with some improvements :)

author: Bob_Philler_s_Bricks
title: My very first Lego set!
review: Since this was my very first Lego set, I can't remember it that much, and of course I didn't get to build the whole thing, because I was like 4, but I remember it being amazing to be able take it a part and have a small army to play around with. I still have some of the parts that came from this set that I recognize in my parts collection, like the tank track pieces, and the super battle Droid. I'm glad I found this on brickset, because it brings me back to where it all started for me. This set doesn't have to be great in technical terms for me to like it, I just like it because of how much it means to me!

author: BrickFactoryINC
title: My classic star wars set
review:
I remember sitting on the couch back in 2007 and watching the commercial for this set I had even remembered going to my local toy store and seeing it day after day, but as a young kid, I could never purchase it.  Many years later I had finally gained up the courage to purchase the set and I have no regrets.  Yes, it has its flaws like it can't roll very well on certain surfaces but if you are a LEGO Star Wars collector then this is a must-have.

 

The building process was fun.  Minifigs are great really add a breath of fresh air to my droid army and the set looks incredible.  This set surely fits in with my droid army and operates like the good old days of LEGO Star Wars.

 

If you are a Star Wars collector this is a must-have, and even if you love the good old days of LEGO Star Wars look no further than this classic.
